text: Jacqueline "Jackie" Joyner-Kersee (born March 3, 1962) is a retired American athlete. She is one of the greatest athletes in the women's heptathlon as well as in the women's long jump. Joyner-Kersee represented the United States at four Olympic games (1984-96). She won a total of three gold, one silver, and two bronze Olympic medals. Joyner-Kersee was voted "the greatest female athlete of the 20th century" by Sports Illustrated magazine. == References == Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:African-American track and field athletes Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the United States Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:Medalists at the 1984 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1996 Summer Olympics
title: Jackie Joyner-Kersee
